Topic.Title: Apple on pace to sell 200 million iPhones in 2013

Message.Msg: . "In particular, Huberty believes that China will be a meaningful catalyst for Apple, particularly if the iPhone 5 ships with carrier China Unicom in December. Her forecast calls for the iPhone 5 to debut on China Telecom in the first quarter of calendar 2013, while a partnership with China Mobile, the largest carrier in the world, could be reached in the second half of 2013. China Mobile is said to be stocking up on nano-SIM cards that would allow customers to run the iPhone 5 on its network." . nvidia doesn't make those nano-SIM parts either, do they? .

Message.Title: nVidia Tegra 3 in 70% of the Top 10 Android Tablets
Message.Msg: Google search for "featured-top-10-best-android-tablets-monthly-power-rankings-september-2012" and select the AndroidHeadlines article Toshiba, Acer, ASUS, Sony and Google all use the Tegra 3 and have seven tablets in the top ten. Motorola and one Samsung use the outdated Dual-core 1Ghz TI OMAP 4430 and one Samsung uses their own SOC Quad-core Exynos at 1.4 Ghz with Mali400MP GPU

Topic.Title: nVidia Tegra 3 in 70% of the Top 10 Android Tablets

Message.Msg: . "Apple Inc. (AAPL) shipments of iPad tablets surged 44 percent to 17 million in the second quarter, giving the company its biggest share of the market in more than a year as devices from competitors lost ground. Apple’s market share climbed to 69.6 percent in the quarter from 58.1 percent in the previous three-month period, according to a report today from IHS. Cupertino, California-based Apple’s share of the tablet market hasn’t been that high since the first quarter of 2011, when it was 70 percent, IHS said." . Google the Inconvenient Facts for yourself, boys: Bloomberg Apple’s IPad Shipments, Market Share Surge, IHS Reports .

Topic.Title: TI at Analysts Day: company to de-emphasize mobile R&D and OMAP

Message.Msg: . Custom cores, boys. Custom designed cores. THAT'S the Future, boys -- as Apple proved with their self-designed A6 chip. That absolutely blew away all other mobile processors. Jen's failed attempt to use stock, off-the-shelf, mail order designs from ARM Holdings, -- and compete with 700 other companies that bought the exact same blueprints -- is going absolutely Nowhere. Why? 'Cause there no money in it. In fact -- as the failed Tegra folly has proven -- there's nothing but Enormous Losses in it. Custom cores, boys. THAT'S the Future. . Separately, how's year 7 of that Project Denver "let's design a core" fiasco going? Hummm? .

Topic.Title: TI at Analysts Day: company to de-emphasize mobile R&D and OMAP

Message.Msg: "Custom cores, boys. Custom designed cores. THAT'S the Future, boys --" ------------------------------ Project Denver
